name: Pebble Beach
description: Home to some of the most beautiful and challenging courses in the world
weather_info: Mediterranean climate with mild temperatures year-round

name: Madden's on Gull Lake
description: Historic resort featuring multiple championship golf courses on Gull Lake
weather_info: Best season: May to September; Summer temperatures average 70-80°F

name: Myrtle Beach
description: Known as the "Golf Capital of the World," Myrtle Beach offers over 80 championship golf courses along the Grand Strand.
best_months: March through May, September through November
weather_info: Subtropical climate with hot summers and mild winters. Spring and fall offer ideal golfing conditions.

name: Charleston
description: Historic coastal city offering a perfect blend of championship golf, lowcountry charm, and southern hospitality. Known for its year-round golf weather and diverse course designs.
best_months: March through May, September through November
weather_info: Subtropical climate with mild winters and warm summers. Spring and fall offer ideal golfing conditions.

name: Kohler
description: Home to the legendary Whistling Straits and Blackwolf Run, Kohler is a premier Midwest golf destination featuring Pete Dye masterpieces along Lake Michigan. The Straits course, host of the 2021 Ryder Cup, offers a links-style experience with stunning lakeside views.
weather_info: Warm summers and cold winters. Peak golf season is late spring through early fall. Lake Michigan influences local weather with occasional strong winds.

name: Farmingdale
description: Home to the legendary Bethpage State Park golf complex, featuring five public courses including the world-renowned Black Course, a multiple U.S. Open venue known for its difficulty and championship pedigree.
nearest_airports: John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK), LaGuardia Airport (LGA)
weather_info: Four distinct seasons with warm summers and cold winters. Best golf conditions in late spring and early fall.

name: Ponte Vedra Beach
description: Home to TPC Sawgrass and PGA Tour headquarters, this Florida golf destination is famous for its championship courses and iconic island green 17th hole at THE PLAYERS Stadium Course.
weather_info: Subtropical climate with mild winters and hot summers. Year-round golf with best conditions in spring and fall.

name: Streamsong
description: A modern golf resort featuring three distinct courses (Red, Blue, and Black) built on former phosphate mining land, offering a unique links-style experience in central Florida.
nearest_airports: Tampa International Airport (TPA), Orlando International Airport (MCO)
weather_info: Subtropical climate with hot summers. Peak season is winter months with mild temperatures and lower humidity.

name: Nekoosa
description: Home to Sand Valley Golf Resort, a modern golf destination built on dramatic sand dunes in central Wisconsin, featuring world-class courses designed by leading architects.
nearest_airports: Alexander Field - South Wood County Airport
weather_info: Continental climate with warm summers and cold winters. Peak golf season is late spring through early fall.

name: Sea Island
description: Luxury coastal resort featuring championship golf courses in a stunning Georgia setting.
nearest_airports: Brunswick Golden Isles Airport (BQK), Jacksonville International Airport (JAX)
weather_info: Subtropical climate with mild winters and warm summers. Spring and fall offer ideal golf conditions.
summary: Sea Island is a Forbes Five-Star resort offering world-class golf along Georgia's coast. Home to PGA Tour's RSM Classic.

name: Sand Valley
description: A modern golf destination featuring stunning sand barrens and dramatic golf courses designed by world-class architects.
nearest_airports: Central Wisconsin Airport (CWA), Milwaukee Mitchell International Airport (MKE)
weather_info: Four distinct seasons with warm summers and cold winters. Best golf weather from late spring through early fall.
summary: Sand Valley is a golf destination that transformed central Wisconsin into a must-visit location for golf enthusiasts.

name: The Greenbrier
description: America's Resort since 1778, offering world-class golf in the Allegheny Mountains.
nearest_airports: Greenbrier Valley Airport (LWB), Roanoke Regional Airport (ROA)
weather_info: Four distinct seasons with mild summers and colorful falls. Best golf weather from late spring through early fall.
summary: The Greenbrier is an iconic American resort featuring golf courses that have hosted numerous professional championships and presidents.

name: Reynolds Lake Oconee
description: Luxury lake resort featuring six championship golf courses set along 374 miles of shoreline.
weather_info: Mild winters and warm summers typical of Georgia. Spring and fall provide ideal golf conditions with comfortable temperatures.
summary: Reynolds Lake Oconee is one of the most diverse golf destinations in the country, featuring six distinctly different golf courses designed by legendary architects.

name: Big Cedar Lodge
description: America's premier wilderness resort featuring five unique golf courses in the Ozark Mountains.
weather_info: Four distinct seasons with mild springs and falls, warm summers, and cool winters. Best golf weather in spring and fall.
summary: Big Cedar Lodge combines world-class golf with stunning Ozarks wilderness, featuring designs by Tiger Woods, Jack Nicklaus, Bill Coore and Ben Crenshaw, and Gary Player.

name: The Broadmoor
description: The Broadmoor in Colorado Springs is a legendary resort offering world-class golf on its East and West courses designed by Donald Ross and Robert Trent Jones Sr.
nearest_airports: Colorado Springs Airport (COS) - 11 miles, Denver International Airport (DEN) - 85 miles
weather_info: Summer highs 75-85°F, mild humidity. Spring/Fall 55-70°F. Winter can see snow.
summary: Historic luxury resort featuring two championship golf courses in the Colorado Rockies.

name: Scottsdale
description: Scottsdale, Arizona is a premier golf destination with over 200 courses in the area, known for desert golf, stunning mountain backdrops, and year-round play.
weather_info: Desert climate with mild winters (65-75°F) and hot summers (95-105°F). Very low rainfall.
summary: Premier desert golf destination with year-round play and stunning Sonoran Desert views.

name: Omni Barton Creek
description: Omni Barton Creek is a luxury golf resort in the Texas Hill Country near Austin, featuring four championship courses designed by Tom Fazio, Bill Coore & Ben Crenshaw, and Arnold Palmer.
weather_info: Hot summers (85-95°F), mild winters (45-65°F). Spring and fall are ideal for golf.
summary: Luxury Texas Hill Country resort featuring four distinct championship courses by renowned architects.

name: Bandon Dunes
description: Bandon Dunes Golf Resort in Oregon is a legendary destination with five authentic links courses on the dramatic Pacific coastline.
nearest_airports: Southwest Oregon Regional Airport (OTH) - 30 miles, Eugene Airport (EUG) - 150 miles
weather_info: Mild summers (60–70°F), frequent coastal wind and fog, limited rainfall.
summary: An iconic links golf experience with rugged coastal beauty. Best for serious golfers; limited nightlife and remote location.

name: Pinehurst
description: Pinehurst in North Carolina is a historic golf mecca with nine distinct courses, including the world-renowned Pinehurst No. 2.
weather_info: Spring/fall highs in 65–75°F range. Summers are hot and humid.
summary: A rich and traditional golf setting with historic roots. Ideal for golf purists, but lacks modern nightlife.

name: Kiawah Island
description: Kiawah Island, located near Charleston, South Carolina, offers five championship courses, including the renowned Ocean Course.
weather_info: Mild winters (50–60°F), warm summers (80–90°F), occasional coastal breezes.
summary: A luxurious coastal retreat offering world-class golf and amenities. Ideal for those seeking both challenge and relaxation.

name: Palm Springs / La Quinta
description: The Palm Springs and La Quinta area in California boasts over 100 golf courses set against a stunning desert backdrop.
weather_info: Hot summers (100–110°F), mild winters (60–70°F), low humidity.
summary: A premier desert golf destination with a wide variety of courses and luxurious resorts. Best visited in cooler months.

name: Hilton Head Island
description: Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, features over 20 championship golf courses designed by renowned architects.
weather_info: Mild winters (50–60°F), warm summers (80–90°F), occasional humidity.
summary: A scenic island destination offering a mix of public and private courses, complemented by beautiful beaches and upscale amenities.

name: Orlando
description: Orlando, Florida, is a golfer's paradise with over 170 courses ranging from public to championship-level, all within close proximity to world-famous attractions.
weather_info: Hot summers (90–95°F), mild winters (60–70°F), occasional rain.
summary: A diverse golf destination with courses suitable for all skill levels, complemented by numerous entertainment options.

name: San Diego
description: San Diego, California, offers more than 70 golf courses with a mix of ocean views, inland hills, and world-famous Torrey Pines.
weather_info: Mild, dry weather year-round (60–75°F), low humidity, little rainfall.
summary: Consistently perfect weather and public-friendly options make San Diego a go-to for casual and serious golfers alike.

name: Naples
description: Naples, Florida, is known for upscale golf and lifestyle, with more than 90 courses, many with public access.
weather_info: Warm winters (70–80°F), hot summers (90–95°F), high humidity, rainy summers.
summary: A high-end golf destination with great winter weather and polished amenities. Best for a laid-back, upscale trip.

name: Boca Raton / West Palm Beach
description: Boca Raton and West Palm Beach offer a strong mix of resort, private, and public golf across Florida's Gold Coast.
nearest_airports: Palm Beach International Airport (PBI) - 4 miles, Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport (FLL) - 25 miles
weather_info: Warm year-round (70–90°F), humid summers, mild dry winters.
summary: A year-round Florida golf hub with beach access and a blend of affordable and luxury options. Popular with groups and retirees.

name: Lake Tahoe
description: Lake Tahoe straddles California and Nevada, offering stunning high-altitude golf with mountain backdrops and nearby casino resorts.
nearest_airports: Reno-Tahoe International Airport (RNO) - 55 miles, Sacramento International Airport (SMF) - 120 miles
weather_info: Cool dry summers (70–80°F), cold winters, high elevation.
summary: Summer-only destination with scenic views, elevation changes, and nightlife. Great for group trips with variety.

name: Brooklyn, New York
description: Golf destination in Brooklyn, New York featuring 2 courses

name: Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida
description: Golf destination in Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida featuring 1 courses

name: Pebble Beach, California
description: Golf destination in Pebble Beach, California featuring 6 courses
